pull.title: refactor: minor whitespace fixups, s/const/constexpr/ and remove template (followup to #19845)

issue.title: net: CNetAddr: add support to (un)serialize as ADDRv2
issue.body:
(chopped off from #19031 to ease review)

Add an optional support to serialize/unserialize `CNetAddr` in ADDRv2 format (BIP155). The new serialization is engaged by ORing a flag into the stream version.

So far this is only used in tests to ensure the new code works as expected.

events.body:
Concept ACK, obviously :) Thanks @vasild  !

Mind also integrating https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19845#discussion_r495730125 as that change was unneeded?

Well, I left it as is because

```cpp
template <typename E>
bool operator()(const E& e) const {
```

is more generic than

```cpp
bool operator()(const std::runtime_error& e) const {
```

both work now but the former would also work if the exception does not inherit `std::runtime_error`.

I don't think the template function is required to make exception handling more generic for the following reasons:
- all custom types in the project inherit from `std::runtime_error`
- if this seems insufficient, the base `std::exception` type could be used
Please describe the actual changes in the pr title/description?
@vasild could you follow up here with @hebasto and @ajtowns comments, as this is a fairly straight-forward change.

CentOS build uses pretty old gcc. Nice that CI caught that issue.

issue.title: [Refactor] Clang-tidy and fix compiler error in HasReason class
issue.body:
Came across this compiler error when updating the [code coverage report](https://www.fuzzbawls.pw/pivx/regression-test-coverage/index.html). The server runs on CentOS 7 currently, which uses a fairly old (but still supported) version of gcc. Indeed, upstream also ran into this error (Ref: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20033)

Some older (but still supported) versions of gcc will throw an error
when trying to convert from `std::ios_base::failure` to `std::runtime_error`.
Use `std::exception` base type instead.

Also apply clang-format to the class and remove the `cout`.
